item.title: Trump tariffs that are voided by — and ones that are safe from — Friday's appeals court ruling
item.description: If the Supreme Court upholds the ruling, President Donald Trump would lose some, but not all, of his broad tariff powers.

item.title: Trump is cutting 500-plus jobs at Voice of America and its parent agency despite legal challenges
item.description: The agency that oversees Voice of America is eliminating jobs for more than 500 employees, a Trump administration official said.

item.title: Most Trump tariffs ruled illegal by appeals court, dealing major blow to trade policy
item.description: The appeals court stayed its ruling until Oct. 14, giving the Trump administration time to ask the Supreme Court to hear the case.

item.title: Federal judge issues order blocking Trump effort to expand speedy deportations of migrants
item.description: A federal judge on Friday temporarily blocked the Trump administration from carrying out speedy deportations of undocumented migrants detained in the ...

item.title: Fate of Fed Gov. Lisa Cook still up in the air after court hearing on Trump firing bid
item.description: Lisa Cook's lawyer said "crazy midnight tweets" by housing official Bill Pulte about alleged mortgage fraud do not give President Trump cause to remov...
